definition: to bear/to carry/to hold/to continue/to undertake/to take charge/owing to/due to/to receive
surname Cheng/Cheng (c. 2000 BC), third of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to melt (metal)/to cancel or annul/to sell/to spend/to fasten with a bolt/bolt or pin
commerce/merchant/dealer/to consult/2nd note in pentatonic scale/quotient (as in 智商[zhi4 shang1], intelligence quotient)

sentences.english: The bookrunner is listed first among all underwriters participating in the issuance.
sentences.chinese: 列出所有参与股票发行的承销商。

sentences.english: A group of underwriters that agrees to purchase a new issue of stock from the issuer for sale to the public.
sentences.chinese: 同意向发行人购买新股并向公众出售的承销商。

sentences.english: That kind of optimism is hard for underwriters to price ahead of time. So is scarcity value.
sentences.chinese: 因为这种乐观主义而让承销商来提前标价是困难的。

sentences.english: Activities by an underwriter to support the offering price of a new issue stock in the aftermarket.
sentences.chinese: 承销商在后市市场支持新股招股价的行动。

definition: to underwrite (i.e. guarantee financing)/underwriting/to sell as agent/consignee
to ration merchandise (esp. food in times of shortages)

pinyin: shou3 ci4 gong1 kai1 zhao1 gu3

definition: to undertake to purchase sth/to subscribe (to share issue)
to have exclusive selling rights/to be the sole agent for a production unit or firm
